body.p:
Ordnance Department
Camp Nelson
February 25th1864
To" His", Excellency,
Governor", Bramlette,
Governor of Kentucky
Dear Sir

Having served my Country as an Officer & Soldier for nearly three years, as an Infantry Soldier & having bin disabled by the loss of my right Arm while engaged in the line of duty at the battle of Richmond Ky, I am disabled as an instructer becaus I cannot handle a musket, & my regiment having reenlisted for three years I am anxious to continue in the Service if I can do my Country any good whatever,
In view of the facts above stated, I have the honor to request that you grant me permission to recruit a company of, Heavy, Artilary as a defense for the state of Ky,

I have the honor to be
Very Respt your obt servt
Lieut, W, H, Ridenour
18th\ Ky Vol Inft, & act ord offiser
